title: EM waves - E and B fields or motion of charges

content.question: Which of the following correctly describes an electromagnetic wave?

choices.label: The wave consists of oscillating electric and magnetic fields, which are both perpendicular to the direction of propagation of the wave.
The wave consists of oscillating electric and magnetic fields, which are both parallel to the direction of propagation of the wave.
The wave consists of oscillating charged particles, which individually move perpendicular to the direction of propagation of the wave.
The wave consists of oscillating charged particles, which individually move parallel to the direction of propagation of the wave.

content.answer: The wave consists of oscillating electric and magnetic fields, which are both perpendicular to the direction of propagation of the wave.
